> <OLD>
>
> Rattrap and Straight Shot nod in agreement to Wing Callibers question.
>
> " Wingcalliber has a point."
>
> Straight Shot says quietly.
>
> " What if Rodimus truly lost the Matrix or what if it got corrupted?  And if
> we don't find it in time?  What then?"

<NEW>

LEO PRIME, who was just reaching the cave entrance glanced back at
STRAIGHT SHOT, his voice low and serious, "Then we are in a graver
danger than we know." He looked back at the cave as if seeing it a
different light. "If whoever it is in there were able to corrupt the
matrix and even create a Dark Matrix . . . " LEO paused signifigantly.

"Then they might prove to be a more powerful foe then we have ever
faced" WING CALIBER finished the thought.

Beside him SANTON nodded while BANTOR looked thoughtful and TORCA and
NOCTORRO had dark looks.

> <OLD>
>
> FOr the moment, BLACKARACHNIA was losing contact even at the bare
> ranges as the PREDACONS spread out.  Within what ordinarily would be
> visual range, here they seemed to be losing awareness of one another's
> existence.  Her scanners gathering increasingly less data and increasing
> interference even within (by Cybertronian standards) point blank range otherwise.
>
> Wherever BLACKARACHNIA's loyalties were, coerced or otherwise, there was
> enough of her left alone to parade with glee.  Assuming this realm stayed
> this way, cut off from everywhere else, she intended to in time work at
> establishing her own base here, cut away from all others.  Rubbing her
> mandibles together with glee at the contemplation, free for her own schemes.

<NEW>

It was not that she was loosing awareness of everyone, although it
might semm like that to some, but that the normal sensors that one
would uyse to detect IFF, radar, sonar and other such things that many
transformers depended on were being disrupted.

The five 'normal' senses were so far undisturbed. She should see,
hear, touch, smell, and, if she chose, taste to her normal levels -
but beyond that she was on her own.

> <OLD>
>
> HOpefully DINOBOT would be able to get close enough to the surface for a
> quick comm burst to CRYOTEK which would explain waht they had encountered
> and what VICE GRIP was doing without going up aboveground, if CRYOTEK had
> not gone too far ahead.

<NEW>

As Com-links were the first thing to go down since they entered the
jungle, he would have to get in voice range and just talk to him. It
was something that might prove easier than he thought.

As DINOBOT was approaching the opening in the surface he could easily
make out the MAXIMALS and PREDACON at the opening peering in. LEO
PRIME and CRYOTEK were at the front with the others ranging out behind
them.

LEO seemed about to say something when CRYOTEK spoke, "What have you
found Dinobot?" He made no mention of the others that he presumed were
with him like DRILLBIT and VICE GRIP, which at the moment none of the
MAXIMALS had seen yet.

(TAG)

- Preston
